subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Separation of Church and State: An American Experiment
description: Learn Separation of Church and State: An American Experiment in one minute.

hook.text: 'Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion.' One sentence. Endless fights over what it means.

buildup.text: The First Amendment created a wall between religion and government. But the wall has always had cracks and doors.

discovery.text: 'In God We Trust' is on the money. Congress opens with prayer. The line between church and state is blurry in practice.

twist.text: Other nations do it differently. France bans religion from public life. The UK has a state church but is more secular.

climax.text: Separation protects both religion and government. When they merge, both become corrupted. History proves this.

punchline.text: Separation protects both church and state. Merge them and both suffer.

quiz.question: Why does separation of church and state matter?
options: It protects both religion and government from corrupting each other
